definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: They're kinda cute when they're not quite big enough to trample you.
sentences.chinese: 當他們沒有長大到足夠攻擊你的時候，還是很可愛的。

sentences.english: I was a nervous child, and when I grew, I was a nervous young man.
sentences.chinese: 我從小膽小怯弱，長大了，仍是一個膽怯的年輕人。

sentences.english: Growing up in a family of musicians, he was saturated with music at an early age.
sentences.chinese: 他在音樂世家長大，小時候就飽受音樂薰陶。

sentences.english: He grew upin Port Arthur, Tex., never knowing his father.
sentences.chinese: 他在亞瑟港長大，從不知道父親是誰。

sentences.english: I mean, you're a grown woman.
sentences.chinese: 她長大後成爲一位亭亭玉立的女子。

sentences.english: My cousin was born in China and grew up in Australia.
sentences.chinese: 我的表妹出生在中國，在澳大利亞長大。

sentences.english: I grew up on a farm, helping my parents.
sentences.chinese: 我在農場長大，幫我父母親分擔農務。

sentences.english: Grandma cooked rice-soup and the family hope you grow up fast.
sentences.chinese: 奶奶米飯，湯和家庭的希望你長大了快。

sentences.english: lot of people have parasomnias in childhood and grow out ofit.
sentences.chinese: 很多人在童年時得了類睡症，長大後就好了。

sentences.english: I wonder if Sasha will remember that moment when she is grown.
sentences.chinese: 我想知道，當莎夏長大後，她是否會記得當時的情景。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, the boy Samuel grew up in the presence of the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 那孩子撒母耳在耶和華面前漸漸長大。

sentences.english: Peole don't want to grow up because of the various pressures and non-freedom.
sentences.chinese: 人們不想長大，因爲各種各樣的壓力和不自由。

sentences.english: I love her to pieces, but I am 28.
sentences.chinese: 我非常愛她，但是我長大了，我已經28了。

sentences.english: The little boy thought he wanted to be a fireman when he grew up.
sentences.chinese: 那個小男孩想在長大後當一位救火員。

sentences.english: “What was it like to grow up with only a father?” Hanfeng asked.
sentences.chinese: 瀚峯問道，“從小長大隻有父親會是怎麼樣呢？”
